comments:
On two separate occasions I've run into this issue when dealing with Indexes.  Once during startup and the other while trying demo the some changes in the Index tab to another colleague.

While trying to demo the index functionality this following message showed up in the log.

ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 2007-10-01 11:36:36.234
!MESSAGE Error getting help keyword index data from provider: org.eclipse.help.internal.index.IndexFileProvider (skipping provider)
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space

In the other case, we had a number number of plugins that had index extension points point to files that did not exist in that plugin.  One of the developers was not able to replicate the issue, but was unsuccessful.  I'm wondering it we are running into the limits of the IC in its base configuration.  

We have, at the moment, approximately 615 plugins/fragments that are roughly 200MB jarred up.  We also have 25000 entries as well.  For DB2, this is the smallest of the InfoCenters that we will have.  We have other groups that use this IC as the base and add install some more plugins into our packaged IC.  

So seeing java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space issues when running the IC is a bit disconcerting to say the least.

The other defect related to index issues is https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=204835

Eric
This is indeed disconcerting. Do you see any other errors in the log? Setting priority to P2.
*** Bug 204835 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Hi Chris,

In the .log file, the only entry that appears that is specifically related to this issue, 2nd person connecting, is the one list in the bug report.  There are other errors related to the indexes.

Here is a sample of the index related errors:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 2007-10-01 11:36:16.028
!MESSAGE Unable to look up label for help keyword index topic "/com.ibm.db2.luw.spatial.topics.doc/doc/csbp4170.html#csbp4170" with missing "label" attribute (topic does not exist in table of contents; using href as label)

!ENTRY org.eclipse.help 4 0 2007-10-01 11:36:16.028
!MESSAGE Unable to look up label for help keyword index topic "/com.ibm.db2.luw.spatial.topics.doc/doc/rsbp4022.html#rsbp4022" with missing "label" attribute (topic does not exist in table of contents; using href as label)

These errors appear because the index tab is trying to add index entries for topics that are in the plugin, but not referenced in the toc XML file.

Eric

I too am having a similar error. I'm not doing anything fancy - start up the infocenter, search for "internationalization" and shortly a Java Heap Space error shows up.

I am using the version of the InfoCenter downloaded from IBM.

I do have a lot of documentation plug-ins installed (the entire WebSphere
set and several Rational ones plus others) but even when I isolate the search
to a single doc I still get the same error.

I'm willing to help as much as needed.

I'm running Sun's JVM on Windows XP SP2

>java -version
java version "1.6.0_02"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_02-b06)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.6.0_02-b06, mixed mode, sharing)

Here's the help_start.bat contents (I've been playing with the -Xms and -Xmx
in increments of 64M to no avail):
java -classpath eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help.base_3.0.1\helpbase.jar org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -eclipsehome eclipse -plugincustomization plugins\com.ibm.help.hs.doc\plugin_customization.ini -command displayHelp -host 127.0.0.1 -clean -noexec -Xms512m -Xmx1024m

Here's the console (help_start.bat cmd window) output:

The last trace indicated that this was happening when assembling the search index. The index gets built the first time you do a search (even if projects have prebuilt indexes they still have to be merged), once it has been built it does not get rebuilt. It may be that the code which builds the search index is not allowing all of the objects used to build that index to be garbage collected until the entire index assembly is complete.
I'm starting to inspect the source to look for possible causes of leakage. I'll also see if I can reproduce using dynamically generated help content.

I'll enable debug for the IC and see if I can get more info into the logs.
